alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 16 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, the community of Tanana along the Yukon River. * WHEN...From 6 PM AKDT this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible at Tanana tonight or Wednesday. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Large ice chunks could also push overbank and into communities. Prepare your community now for flooding, and where possible, move items to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The breakup front is moving past Tanana this afternoon, with an approximately 120 mile run of bank-to-bank ice chunks and pans approaching Tanana from Rampart Canyon as reported from the RiverWatch flight team. There is still ice in place 40 miles downriver from Tanana, and when the upstream run of ice reaches this point, it may potentially jam and cause significant water level rises at Tanana. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River near Tanana stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
